thread.title: Proposed bill could limit daily fantasy sports sites in Pa.
thread.title_full: Proposed bill could limit daily fantasy sports sites in Pa.

title: Proposed bill could limit daily fantasy sports sites in Pa.
text:
Proposed bill could limit daily fantasy sports sites in Pa. 
Updated: Wed, Oct 21 2015, 09:45 AM 
By: Kyle Rogers 
HARRISBURG, Pa. -- A piece of legislation in Pennsylvania may limit daily fantasy sports websites.Rep. George Dunbar, a Republican representing Westmoreland County, hopes those particular websites, such as Fan Duel and Draft Kings, will be run by the state's 12 casinos in a new proposal.The proposal is slated for a committee vote in the state House of Representatives.A hearing on the matter was supposed to be held Wednesday morning, but the matter before the House Gaming Oversight Committee was postponed. Maybe they went back to the future? pic.twitter.com/39sEDog7hP â€” Kyle Rogers (@KyleCBS21) October 21, 2015 
Dunbar hopes the legislation would benefit casinos by drawing people to their websites and in turn, boost the state's revenue. Related Stories
